Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BmKn-21 (BmKn2 analog, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: C-terminal amino acid truncation, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toparent peptide BmKn2I: 25%, L=A: 17%.Activity: inhibited biofilm formation of P. aeruginosa, strongest in this truncated peptide series. Only this peptide in this series also inhibited bacterial growth, indicating all other peptides are only weak antibiofilm peptides.Structure: predicted to be helical.In vitro toxicity: sheep RBC: hemolytic. Toxic to L929 cells as well.
Literature Information.Author: Teerapo K, Roytrakul S, Sistayanarain A, Kunthalert D. 2019
Literature Information.Title: A scorpion venom peptide derivative BmKn-22 with potent antibiofilm activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
